name: el Jardi

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have stayed at El Jardi several times, and also the sister hotel La Terrassa. Situated nicely in the Barri Gotic and close to the Ramblas, it overlooks the Placa Sant Josep Orial and is sideways on to Palca del Pi. Accommodation is basic but clean and rooms facing either square are excellent value but need to be booked well in advance. One square holds an art display daily and the other a food market. Each square has bars and restaurants ideal for people watching. We try to visit during the Merce Festival in September, one of Barcelona's best kept secrets. Non stop entertainment, bands of all types, fireworks and beautiful displays of the elegant catalan sardanas dance. We awoke one morning to a group of Castellers practicing outside our window and we were 3 floors up. Lovely.
reviews.title: El Jardi Floats our boat

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed in hotel jardi in barcelona for 6 nights. Great value for money, very central,rooms are very clean and hotel saff very helpful and friendly. Would recommend this hotel. Rooms are very quiet, not much noise.
reviews.title: Half term break

reviews.text: I stayed at El Jardi for two nights in November. I had a standard exterior room that overlooked one of the plazas -- I say "one of" because there are two adjoining plazas upon which the hostal sits. The room was basic and small with two twin beds, a desk with tv stand and armoire -- not much more room to move. The bathroom was basic with a small shower stall. Keep in mind the walls were thin as I heard most of the noise from the adjoining room as well as when the window is open, the plaza can be noisy. (I also always bring ear plugs so that is rarely a hugely upsetting issue for me. I merely point it out to encourage others to do the same.) Also, the wifi only seemed to work in the lobby area. That being said, the location was fantastic -- surrounded by such lovely plazas in Barri Gothic. The staff was friendly and helpful. The room was clean. The price was on par for what I would expect. Overall, good experience. If I were to take a short trip to Barcelona again, I would definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: Simple accommodations in great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for 3 nights and had an absolutely fantastic time. The location was perfect for us as it is situated in a picturesque square that is bustling with activity and yet remains both charming and practical for eating, drinking and shopping.
reviews.title: Perfect for us

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff were extremely friendly and courteous with both our check in and departure being smooth and efficient.
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel has a fantastic location which is definitely the best offering at this hotel, however, it is not the only thing going for it. The simplicity of the rooms is reflected in the price, yet they are clean, comfortable and everything you need. Rooms may include balconies or terraces with great views of the cathedral or square. I would stay here again without question. Free WiFi too.
reviews.title: Very Good Hotel

reviews.text: We recently stayed at El Jardi (4 people, 2 rooms) and were very pleased overall. The location is great, near everything. The front desk and cleaning staff are all very friendly and helpful. The breakfast for 6 euros is nothing special, but it is convenient and served in a little room off the lobby, where a computer for guest use is also located. There are stairs from the street to the lobby, which management explains when you book. If you want a room with a huge terrace, be sure you ask specifically for that. We thought that is what we were getting, but we ended up with tiny Romeo and Juliet balconies. They were fine rooms and our stay was short so we didn't ask to move. We found the experience of staying there very good. It was our second stay with Jardi and we'll stay there again if we are lucky enough to find ourselves in Barcelona again!
reviews.title: great location & great value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is in a great location, just a 10-15 minute walk from where the airport shuttle bus drops you off at Placa de Catalunya. It's situated in a small square just off La Rambla and there are plenty of restaurants nearby. Our room had a balcony, however it wasn't big enough to sit out on. The room had a double bed and just about enough room to walk down each side and that's about it as far as space is concerned. The shower in the bathroom was a bit of a challenge for me being over six foot. With the balcony doors closed there was no noise problem from the square below and the air conditioning worked a treat. The room was spotlessly clean and the staff friendly. We stayed three nights and would definitely stay again but for a longer stay would probably want a little more room.
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a room with balcony overlooking the square. The location of the hostel is perfect. Lots of entertaining things to see right outside from the balcony, so we spent a lot of time just sitting with a glass of wine, people watching. The room was big, air conditioning worked great. More than enough room for 2 ppl (considering the size of other hotels in Europe).
reviews.title: Great location, good size room, great views from the balcony
Great location!
reviews.text: A mini fridge would have been nice to keep our drink and snacks cool.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Don't be put off by the word hostel- this is anything but. A fantastic hotel in a brilliant location just off the Ramblas. Set in a delightful square with many bars and restaurants within walking distance. The staff are excellent and the room we had on the eight floor was superb with its own private terrace with great views over the square and rooftops of the city. Would definitely stay again.
reviews.title: Hidden Gem

reviews.text: The title says it all, this is a clean, no frills place but in a great setting between 2 squares with lots of rooms with views and tiny balconies. This was my second visit this year and other than problems with the safe key I was very happy. I think it is time to invest in digital safes.
reviews.title: Wonderful location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Hotel El Jardi is excellent value for money and wonderfully positioned right in the centre of the old part of Barcelona. It is spotlessly clean and the room we had had am delightful roof terrace with table and chairs. There was a well equipped shower room, a small dressing table/storage shelves, a large wardrobe and a TV. The room was well lit and were was an excellent air conditioning/heating unit .All the staff were friendly and helpful, especially those on the reception desk who were very knowledgeable about the sites of Barcelona.
reviews.title: Very central, ho frills, great place to stay

reviews.text: Great location and helpful friendly staff, but little else to recommend. Tiny rooms, 30cm depth balcony with a great view. Taxi driver could not find it from the Ramblas as streets pedestrian or one way.
reviews.title: Central hotel, space at a premium.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hostal Jardi doesn't try promote itself as something it is not. It is not luxury accommodations but it is very clean, centrally located and the staff is friendly and welcoming. You do have to climb a flight of stairs to get to the reception area, which my husband and I did not think was a big deal but then there is a small elevator to take you to the upper floors. Breakfast is served at an additional cost, if it is desired. I should mention that the hostal is on a small plaza that can be a little noisy but having said that, the windows that lead to our little balcony (which was lovely) were double paned and kept out most of the noise. We were in a room facing the square on the same floor as the reception.
reviews.title: Very basic but clean and centrally located

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We chose the El Jardi because of its great location and good reviews but had rather a disappointing stay. Our room was a good size with little balcony overlooking a pretty square but we weren't told that rooms are serviced only every second day resulting in a missed siesta whilst we waited for a housekeeper! We were on the 6th floor which was a bit of a problem when the lift failed and little interest was shown in fixing it. Also the coffee machine was out of action so we had breakfast out, no problem luckily as there are good options on the Ramblas. Barcelona is a wonderful place to visit for a few days with so much to see and do. A jazz/blues trio at the Jamboree club was a particular pleasure. Also a Saturday morning in the busy park ,very popular with local families and having a spectacular fountain. The elegant Placa Reial was one of the cheaper places to eat and have a beer surprisingly.
reviews.title: Worth a visit in spite of problems

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Located in the Plaza del Pi makes el Jardi a prime spot for rambling on las Ramblas or visiting el Barri Gotic, and other amazing places. My husband and I stayed for 4 nights in April 2013 and we absolutely loved the modern comfort and central location of this awesome hotel. Our room had a pretty (albeit tiny) balcony facing the Plaza and we loved people watching from our room. They have installed a ridiculously small elevator in a 300 year old building. It was enough to get myself, my husband and our backpacks up to our room so it was perfect - though cramped. They have free WIFI in the their lobby, and if your device is powerful enough, in your room. There is a Cathedral next door and like most cathedrals with bells, they toll the bells - starting around 7 AM, so bring earplugs if you like to sleep in. There is a small organic farmers market on the weekends in the little plaza next door. When we come back to Barcelona we will stay at the El Jardi without hesitation and without needing to look at any other hotel. I thoroughly recommend this place!
reviews.title: Lovely Hotel in a Great Location

reviews.text: Small hotel in one of the prettiest location in Barri Gotic. 5 mn walk from Ramblas, nice view on Plaça Sant Josep Oriol and Plaça del Pi. 8 floors, narrow corridors and staircases. No lounge. Clean rooms, fair prices.
reviews.title: Pretty place near Ramblas

reviews.text: We booked El Jardi first of all because we were looking for a good value hotel in the Bari Gothic. El Jardi fulfilled way more than these two criteria. The rooms are quaint and clean with a lovely view on the plaza below. The staff was most welcoming and helpful. So close to the Ramblas you can walk to the amazing market, the beach and the metro is right there too if you feel more adventurous. It is lovely to walk around the pedestrian streets around the hotel and enjoy the cafés too. I also recommend the great value breakfast.
reviews.title: Charm, good value and great location
Nice hotel, great location, good value
reviews.text: We stayed in this hotel for our first three nights in Barcelona. The location of the hotel is great for sightseeing downtown, just minutes from the Ramblas. The rooms are very clean, good bed and a very nice view over the square below. From our balcony we have enjoyed a lot of streetperformers and lovely sunrises. Keep in mind this hotel is in the middle of a busy part of town, so expect noise from outside on weekend nights, sunday and monday were quiet, we could sleep with our balcony doors open. Breakfast is simple, but costs us only 6 euros, so its a fair price. We would come back here and do recommend this hotel

description: With a privileged location, "el Jardí" is at the artistic and commercial heart of the city center. The Plaça del Pi, near Las Ramblas is a meeting point for visiting the main sights. On foot, you can visit the Cathedral, the Plaça Catalunya and the Palau de la Generalitat, the Passeig de Gracia, el Born district, the beach, the maremagnum or the port.In a 300 years old building, "el Jardí" offers 40 rooms equipped with bathroom, air conditioning / heating, safety box, satellite TV and telephone. The lobby is wi-fi ready and there is a personal computer available for our customers. "el Jardí" also offers the option of a Continental breakfast.With a friendly atmosphere and a multilingual team, our reception strives every day to provide a personalized attention to our guests.
